gurmukhi: bwxy AMg BujMgI swvl sohxy ] qRY sY h`Q auqMgI KMfw DUihAw ]
transliteration: Baane An Bhujanisaaval Sohane|| Trai Sai Bathh Outanikhandaa Dhoohiaa||
translation: The army (with Kalki) had worn beautiful garments and that three hundred hands long-sized Kalki drew out his double-edged sword;

gurmukhi: qwjI Baur iplMgI CwlwN pweIAwN ] BMgI jwx iBVMgI n`cy dwierI ]180]
transliteration: Taajibhaur Pilanichhalaan Paaeeaan|| Bhanijaan Bhidaninachche Daaitee||180||
translation: The horses sprung like leopards and began to rotate.180.

gurmukhi: b`jy nwd surMgI AxIAwN ju`tIAwN ] pYrY Dwr pvMgI PaujwN cIr kY ]
transliteration: Bajje Naad Surani Aneeaan Joutteeaan|| Pairai Dhaar Pavaniphaujaan Cheer Kai||
translation: The trumpets were sounded and the armies confronted each other; the warriors advanced through the armies;

gurmukhi: auTY CYl ClMgI CwlwN pweIAwN ] JwV JVwk JVMgI qygwN v`jIAwN ]181]
transliteration: Outhai Chhail Cdhaalanichhalaan Paaeeaan|| Jhaad Jhadaak Jhadanitegadn Vajjeeaan||181||
translation: They sprang and revolved and the swords struck with jerks.181.

gurmukhi: jU dyK dyK kY sbY ] su Bwj Bwj gy qbY ] kihE su soB soB hI ] iblok lok loB hI ]182]
transliteration: Joo Dekh Dekh Kai Sabai|| Su Bhaaj Bhaaj Ge Tabai|| Kahio Su Sobh Sobh Hi|| Bilok Lok Lobh Hi|| 182||
translation: Seeing him, all ran away, everyone coveted to see him.182.

gurmukhi: pRcMf rUp rwjeI ] iblok Bwn lwjeI ] su cMf qyj ieauN lsYN ] pRcMf joq ko hsYN ]183]
transliteration: Prachanndd Roop Raajaee|| Bilok Bhaan Laajai|| Su Channd Tej Ion Lasain|| Prachanndd Jot Ko Basain||183||
translation: Seeing his powerful form, the sun is feeling shy and his effulgence is mocking the powerful light.183.

gurmukhi: su kop kop kY hTI ] cpy icrwie ijau BTI ] pRcMf mMflI lsYN ] ik mwrqMf ko hsYN ]184]
transliteration: Su Kop Kop Kai Hathee|| Chape Chiraae Jio Bhathee|| Prachanndd Mandalilasain|| Ki Maartand Ko Basain||184||
translation: The persistent warriors in rage are inflamed like the furnace; the powerful group of warriors is even scoffing at the sun.184.

gurmukhi: su kop Ep dY blI ] ik rwj mMflI clI ] su AsqR SsqR pwn lY ] ibsyK vIr mwn kY ]185]
transliteration: Su Kop Op Dai Bali|| Ke Raaj Mandalichalee|| Su Astra Shastra Paan Lai|| Bisekh Veer Maan Kai||185||
translation: The soldiers of the king advanced in rage and they were holding their arms and weapons in their hands.185.

gurmukhi: Bt SsqR AsqR ncwie ] icq kop Ep bFwie ] qr k`Cu A`C qurMg ] rx rMg cwr auqMg ]186]
transliteration: Bhat Shastra Astra Nachaae|| Chit Kop Op Badhaae|| Tar Kachchh(u) Achchh Turan|| Ran Ran Chaar Outan||186||
translation: Imbued with the idea of fighting, getting enraged, the warriors riding the horses are swinging their arms and weapons.186.

gurmukhi: kr kRoD pIsq dwNq ] kih Awp Awpn bwq ] Bt Bry hv huAY vIr ] kr kop Cwfq qIr ]187]
transliteration: Kar Krodh Peesat Daant|| Kah(i) Aap Aapan Baat|| Bhat Bhare Hab Buai Veer|| Kar Kop Chhaadat Teer||187||
translation: In their fury, they are grinding their teeth and talking in themselves and filled with ego these warriors are discharging their arrows.187.

gurmukhi: kr kop kil Avqwr ] gih pwn Ajwn kuTwr ] qnkyk kIn pHwr ] Bt jUJ gXo sY cwr ]188]
transliteration: Kar Kop Kal(i) Avtaar|| Gadh Paanndajaan Kouthaar|| Tankek Kleen Prahaar|| Bhaat Joojh Gyo Sai Chaar||188||
translation: Kalki, getting infuriated caught hold of His axe in his long arms and with its slightest blow, four hundred warriors died and fell down.188.
